_header: When earth hath earth with wrong I-got
Subjects: transitoriness, of world; vanity, against worldly

BodHolkM39.Transcription:
Qwan erde hath erde wyth wo I geteAnd erde ys in erde wyth erde I
                    rekeAnd erde ys vnder erde with vyrmys I freteþan chal erde on
                    erde sone ben for ȝete
BodHolkM39.Editions:
Pope,  Nancy. 
             “Erthe upon Erthe Revisited.” 
             Journal of the Early Book Society
         21 (2018): 53-95: 62.

BLAdd25478.First Lines:
Whanne eorthe hath eorthe wiþ wrong igeteAnd eorthe in eorthe
                    beginneþ to alete…
BLAdd25478.Last Lines:
…Wyte eorthe from eorthe þat ne be furloren& bringe
                    eorthe to þat eorthe þer beþ his icoren
BLAdd25478.Editions:
Murray,  Hilda M. R.,
                        ed.  
             The Middle English Poem Erthe upon Erthe, printed from 24
                manuscripts.
EETS
         o.s. 141 (1911); repr. 1964: 42-5.

PierpontM957.First Lines:
What haþ erþe vpon erþe [ ]Whan erþe vpon
                    erþe [ ]And erþe in to erþe [ ]…
PierpontM957.Note: Begins imperfectly; at least eleven lines.

Pope,  Nancy.
